subtitle: [music]
In this grounding meditation, you can more deeply
and calmly connect with your own body and the earth.
Grounding to the earth can help your mind, body and spirit
function more smoothly, efficiently and effortlessly.
It may help you to heal from or prevent
illness or disease when engaged in regularly.
Go ahead and get comfortable in a seated or resting position, perhaps even lying down.
And take a few gentle, slow, deep breaths in
and out, noticing the sensations in your body.
How do you feel in your body?
Notice your experience without labeling it as good or bad, right or wrong.
Set an intention of how you would like to feel in
your body, how you would like to be in your body,
how you would like to move in your body, such as
feeling calm, relaxed, peaceful, pain-free, joyful,
feeling alive, light, effortless, whole, centered and complete.
You are of the earth by having a physical body.
The earth is in you. You are in the earth. Everything is interconnected.
Just as is the whole divine universe.
Connect with the earth by feeling the gentle pull of earth's gravity.
Allow your breath to be even and steady.
Imagine yourself as a tree, plant or flower. What kind would you be?
Imagine roots extending from your body, from your feet and your legs,
extending down into the earth below you as far as you would like them to be.
Draw up this nurturing and revitalizing energy for you from the earth.
Let the earth absorb any unnecessary energy
that is no longer serving a purpose for you.
Allow this energy to dissolve and recycle into something else.
Allow it to be replaced with something more healing, such
as the energy, support and care of a thousand mothers.
Draw up this healing earth's vibration, this
aliveness, this oneness and connectedness.
Bring into you what you need from the earth, the elements such as water, soil,
air, foliage, fire, whatever it is you feel you need.
See and feel this earth's vibration rising up into you
through your feet, your legs, slowly moving into your torso,
into your arms and all the way up into your head, clearing and calming the mind.
Restoring your body, revitalizing your spirit.
You are one with the earth as your body houses your
spirit and allows you to move freely upon the earth.
You may find it helpful to be or sit in nature or imagine being in nature.
To rest in the cool grass or go for a walk barefoot if possible.
Feeling the solid earth below you and the sun on your body.
Healing any past wounds allowing you to go forward with joy and love in your spirit.
If your mind wanders just have an oh well attitude and bring
your attention back to your body and what you're focusing on.
Spend as much time as you would like grounding and connecting with the earth.
Receiving care from the earth and giving care
back to the earth. Thank you for being with me.
